Hot Off the Press! Honeywell Forecasts Business Jet Usage Will Recover to 2019 Levels by the Second Half of 2021
Honeywell’s 29th annual Global Business Aviation Outlook forecasts up to 7,300 new business jet deliveries worth $235 billion from 2021 to 2030, down 4% in deliveries from the same 10-year forecast a year ago. Despite the dip, 4 of 5 business jet operators in the survey indicate that purchase plans have not been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.

By Jim Johnson, Sr. Manager Flight Technical Services Ever get a request from Honeywell technical support to perform a "control D download" on your FMZ-2000 FMS? Not sure what that is or how to do it? This video will provide the why and how.
LEARN MORE <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/learn/about-us/news/2020/10/inside-fms-ctrl-d-download-fmz-2000?utm_source=email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=20_cps&utm_content=newsletter-sep]]> The Future is Cleaner Air Travel By David Rogers, Program Pilot, Honeywell
Six months ago, no one could have imagined the way life would look today. Worldwide economies shut down, passenger air travel came to a screeching halt and one of the most booming segments of the U.S. economy looked like it may never recover. Speculation about the return of aviation has been all over the map, including estimates from the end of the year to three or five years out.
Fast forward a few months and things appear to finally be slowly trending upwards. Business and general aviation appear to be returning more quickly than airline travel but both appear to finally be moving in a positive direction. While we don’t know when passenger travel will return to normal, one thing we do know is protecting passengers and crew is becoming more of a priority than ever. Cockpit and cabin sterilization will become an essential part of aviation operations.
Honeywell is there to help, creating products that enhance confidence through the entire journey. We apply our decades of experience producing personal protective equipment, aircraft systems and building-management technologies. Listen to Becky Sidelinger, <[[https://www.honeywell.com/en-us/tech-forum#register]]> President of the Mechanical Systems & Components business in Honeywell Aerospace as she presented on our current and upcoming solutions for cleaner air travel (Honeywell Tech Forum registration required to access the presentation – once registered, visit the Aerospace section). Click here <[[mailto:Perry.Pelitera@Honeywell.com]]> to speak to Perry Pelitera, Inside Sales Manager, about our solutions for cleaner air travel or visit the Safety Shop <[[https://www.honeywell.com/en-us/shop/safety]]> for more information on our personal protective equipment.
READ MORE <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/learn/about-us/news/2020/10/cleaner-air-travel-honeywell-safety-packs?utm_source=email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=20_cps&utm_content=newsletter-sep]]> Winter is Coming … Be More Prepared with the RDR-7000 Weather Radar
Comprehensive information about weather conditions is a critical factor for efficient, reliable and safe aircraft operations. Weather-related delays, cancellations and damage are costly to aircraft operators annually. With the IntuVue RDR-7000 <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/learn/products/weather-radar/rdr-7000]]>, we’re offering business aircraft operators the lightest weight and most technically advanced radar available. Click here <[[mailto:Perry.Pelitera@Honeywell.com]]> to speak to Perry Pelitera, Inside Sales Manager about the program.

It’s no surprise that NBAA 2020 is going virtual with “VBACE 2020” and we’re excited to be participating! Be sure to visit our virtual 3D exhibit where we’ll highlight products, services and solutions all designed to help you fly safer, smarter, and more efficiently. You’ll be able to walk through our exhibit, watch informative videos, find details on the latest product and services, and speak to us live!
We’ll be ready to connect with you during VBACE and are counting the days when we can be together in person. Look for specific event details and registration coming soon. IT’S NOT TOO LATE – The Honeywell Tech Forum is still live and we’d love for you to join us
The Honeywell Tech Forum 2020 has delivered incredible insights and conversation so far! Visit the forum site to register and watch on-demand content for all the Honeywell Aerospace sessions, including the “Business Aviation: Optimizing Passenger Experience with Connectivity” panel discussion featuring Honeywell, Inmarsat and NetJets leadership. Explore business panels on cleaner air travel, a hangar tour of Honeywell’s corporate fleet, and more across all of Honeywell’s businesses. And be sure to join us for the closing session on October 28th at 11:00am EDT, where we’ll address what’s happening in the world today, including recapping the past month, and where we are going from here!

Peter Kropik is the Vice President of Customer and Product Support for Honeywell Aerospace. With years of experience in software and IT integrations, Peter played an integral part in the development of the Honeywell user experience and end-to-end journey, and now, more recently, has spent the last few years within the Customer & Product Support organization.
LISTEN HERE <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/learn/about-us/podcasts/customer-support?utm_source=email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=20_cps&utm_content=newsletter-sep]]> Honeywell Forge Puts You in Control with Content Filtering
It’s getting easier for business aircraft operators to control the content Wi-Fi users access online without adversely affecting passenger experience. Improvements to Honeywell Forge Content Filtering let operators block passenger access to certain categories of content they consider unnecessary – like software updates, online shopping and adult content – to reduce data use, save money and free up network space for higher priority uses.
